Source:  Field Health Services Information Systems (FHSIS), 2018    Definition:  Barangay Health Workers  Based on the Republic Act No. 7883, known as the Barangay Health Workersâ€™ Benefits and Incentives Act of 1995, a barangay health worker refers to a person who has undergone training programs under any accredited government and non-government organization and who voluntarily renders primary health care services in the community after having been accredited to function as such by the local health board in accordance with the guidelines promulgated by the Department of Health (DOH).    Computation:  Total number of active Barangay Health Workers as reported in the FHSIS 2018
